title: Daśa-vidha Nāmāparādha
author: Bengali poem composed by
Śrīla Bhakti Sundar Govinda Dev-Goswāmī Mahārāj
subtitle: The Ten Offences to the Holy Name

translation: Hare Krishna Mahāmantra — of all mantras the best,<br class="SongVerse__break" />Throughout the world is preached by saints’ potent grace behest;<br class="SongVerse__break" />Such saints to the Name devoted, such pure souls great:<br class="SongVerse__break" />Never dare offend them — never show them hate.

Lord Krishna, son of Nanda, of all lords the Leader —<br class="SongVerse__break" />The great Shiva and all the gods serve His feet forever;<br class="SongVerse__break" />The touchstone of the Name is Krishna incarnate —<br class="SongVerse__break" />His Pastimes, nature, form, also think not separate.

“Guru’s a form of Krishna — the Scriptures corroborate;<br class="SongVerse__break" />In the form of Guru, Krishna blesses the fortunate.”<br class="SongVerse__break" />Never offend that Guru by thinking him mere mortal;<br class="SongVerse__break" />Gain your highest objective — serve the Name for time eternal.

text: sei śruti śāstra jebā karaye nindana
translation: The Vedas with Mother Gāyatrī and Śrīmad-Bhāgavatam<br class="SongVerse__break" />Illuminate the lotus feet of Śrī Hari’s Name;<br class="SongVerse__break" />Whoever vilifies those Holy Vedic Scriptures —<br class="SongVerse__break" />Never keep their company, know them as offenders.

text: atistuti, heno kabhu nā bhāviha mane
translation: The glories of the Name — all Scriptures’ exaltation;<br class="SongVerse__break" />Dare not think their praise to be exaggeration.<br class="SongVerse__break" />Agastya, Ananta, Brahmā, Shiva, etc., ever<br class="SongVerse__break" />Sing the glories of that Name with full-hearted fervour.<br class="SongVerse__break" />Who can cross the ocean of the glories of that Name?<br class="SongVerse__break" />Whoever says ‘exaggeration’ have their sin to blame.
The Holy Names of Krishna — eternal wealth of Goloka:<br class="SongVerse__break" />Who thinks those Names imaginary, mundane — he’s offender.

All Scriptures claim the Name all sin it can destroy,<br class="SongVerse__break" />But those who spend their time in sin making it a ploy —<br class="SongVerse__break" />Such a wicked attitude is that of an offender<br class="SongVerse__break" />Deceived by illusion, perpetually to suffer.

text: tāra sama nā bhāviha śubha-karma ādi
translation: Incomparable Name of Krishna — the treasure of ecstasy:<br class="SongVerse__break" />Never dare compare it with auspicious piety.
Those who’re faithless t’ward the Name — deceived by Providence: <br class="SongVerse__break" />Giving them the Holy Name surely’s an offence.

text: śuddha kṛṣṇa-nāma tāra kabhu nāhi sphure
translation: Despite them hearing the infinite glories of Krishna’s Name,<br class="SongVerse__break" />Those whose hearts don’t melt in love are rascals of ill fame;<br class="SongVerse__break" />Only pride and avarice their thoughts and deeds do yield —<br class="SongVerse__break" />The Pure Name of Krishna to them is ne’er revealed.

Casting off these ten offences, leaving no exception,<br class="SongVerse__break" />Those pure souls who chant the Name in Holy Congregation —<br class="SongVerse__break" />The miracle of love for Krishna they will surely savour,<br class="SongVerse__break" />The Name Divine Himself will shine within their hearts forever.
